name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the basic unit of naphthalene, which has a melting point of 95.0 °C. The pyridine ring and the methylamino group both contribute to the melting point, with the pyridine ring increasing the melting point due to its rigidity and the methylamino group raising it due to the additional hydrogen bonding potential. The naphthalene ring also contributes to the melting point due to its size and molecular weight. The presence of the carbonyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to the formation of hydrogen bonds and the rigidity it introduces.
